item.title: Command Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Benz Benz
item.description:
@Benz wrote:

that one works. so i thought the text file didnt save...

The compiler won’t compile .txt files. Make sure your file extension is correct.

item.title: Command Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Jeremy368 Jeremy368
item.description:
@Jeremy368 wrote:

hmm this is weird i had a old command i made just to c what i could do here it is [code]else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“wizzy2”))
{

c.addItem(2904, 1);
c.addItem(2906, 1);
c.addItem(2908, 1);
c.addItem(2910, 1);
c.addItem(2912, 1);

}[/code]
and it worked fine perfectly fine so i thought i will just edit this and put what i want in it so i got this [code]else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“dragon”))
{

c.addItem(1149, 1);
c.addItem(3140, 1);
c.addItem(4087, 1);
c.addItem(4587, 1);
c.addItem(1187, 1);

}[/code] but now after i compile and run it nothing happends when i type “::dragon” but if i type the previouse command “::wizzy2” that one works. so i thought the text file didnt save… i went back and it saved…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 22, 2008, 06:09:21 pm[/size][hr]This makes no sense i checked the code and saved the text file then used ur complier and the “::wizzy2” that is not even in the command handler text file still works and the “::dragon” command dose not what goin on?>

Read full topic

item.title: Command Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Doom32dd Doom32dd
item.description:
@Doom32dd wrote:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
